CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the new alternating copolymer synthesized in the paragraph.
2. spirobifluorene: This is the name of the repeating unit in the PSFDTBT copolymer.
3. thiophene: This is another repeating unit in the PSFDTBT copolymer.
4. benzothiadiazole: This is another repeating unit in the PSFDTBT copolymer.
5. PC61BM: This is the name of an electron acceptor material used in the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM.
6. PC71BM: This is another name of an electron acceptor material used in the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM.
7. o-dichlorobenzene (DCB): This is the solvent used for spin-casting the pristine PSFDTBT film.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the provided text:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the new alternating copolymer synthesized in the paragraph.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to "Material Name" in the provided paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the new alternating copolymer synthesized in the study.
2. spirobifluorene: This is the unit used to construct the alternating copolymer PSFDTBT.
3. thiophene: Another unit used to construct the alternating copolymer PSFDTBT.
4. benzothiadiazole: Another unit used to construct the alternating copolymer PSFDTBT.
5. o-dichlorobenzene (DCB): The solvent used to spin-cast the pristine PSFDTBT film.
6. PC61BM: A fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the BHJ structure.
7. PC71BM: Another fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the BHJ structure.
8. HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital): The highest energy level in the molecule that can absorb electrons.
9. LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital): The lowest energy level in the molecule that can emit electrons.
10. carrier mobility: The speed at which charge carriers (electrons or holes) move through the polymer.
11. BHJ (bulk heterojunction): The structure of the active layer in polymer solar cells, consisting of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives.
12. PCE (power conversion efficiency): The ratio of the output power to the input power of a solar cell, expressed as a percentage.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the property name of a material:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the new alternating copolymer synthesized in the study.
2. PC61BM: This is a fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the BHJ structure.
3. PC71BM: Another fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the BHJ structure.

These are the only entities in the text that refer directly to the property name of a material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the paragraph that refer to the property name of a material, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Optical band gap:
The optical band gap of PSFDTBT is 1.97 eV.
2. HOMO energy level:
The low-lying HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT is -5.4 eV.
3. Hole mobility:
The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin-cast from o-dichlorobenzene (DCB) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1.
4. On/off ratios:
The on/off ratios of PSFDTBT and PC71BM blend films are in the order of 10^5.
5. Open-circuit voltage (Voc):
The open-circuit voltage of polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM is 0.94 V.
6. Power conversion efficiency (PCE):
The power conversion efficiency of polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM without any post-treatment is 4.6%.
7. Material solubility:
PSFDTBT is soluble in common organic solvents for solution processing.

Note: The values of material properties are given in units of energy (eV) and mobility (cm^2 V^-1 s^-1) unless otherwise stated.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. Optical band gap: 1.97 eV
2. HOMO energy level: -5.4 eV
3. Hole mobility: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
4. Open-circuit voltage (Voc): 0.94 V
5. Power conversion efficiency (PCE): 4.6%

These are the material properties that are directly related to the performance of the polymer solar cell, and their values are given in units of energy (eV) and mobility (cm^2 V^-1 s^-1).
